p: This new beta-coronavirus was named MERS-CoV [ 13]. It belongs to lineage C and is closely related to Tylonycteris bat coronavirus HKU4 (Ty-BatCoV HKU4) and Pipistrellus bat coronavirus HKU5 (Pi-BatCoV HKU5) [ 13]. The dromedary camel is known to be the intermediate host of MERS-CoV. The widely expressed cell-surface protease dipeptidyl-peptidase 4 (also known as CD26) was identified as a functional receptor for host cell entry [ 90].
